learning_outcomes.description: Identify conservation issues and the key ecological, social and political factors involved with them.
Learn to critically analyse a conservation issue and present that information in concise writing
Apply science to solve real conservation problems.
Evaluate arguments about conservation issues, expressing them verbally and in written form.

assessments.assessment_title: Recorded radio interview on a conservation issue
assessments.due_date:
20/08/2024 11:00 am

Submission will be direct to Dr Richard Fuller during the prac class
assessments.task_description: For this assessment, you will get together in groups of three, and record a 3-5 minute (NO LONGER!) radio interview based around an interesting or controversial contemporary conservation issue. The issue can be Australia-focused, or be an overseas conservation problem. Particularly interesting issues will be those where there are multiple stakeholders with strongly opposing views on the best way forward. We will play the best recordings to the whole class. You might want to have one person act as a presenter, and the other two acting as interviewees with opposing views on the conservation issue being treated, but other appropriate configurations could be attempted. All ideas will need to be submitted and approved by the course co-ordinator BEFORE you start preparing the recording - full details will be covered in class.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission will be direct to Dr Richard Fuller during the prac class, e.g. via email or memory stick
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Based on the work carried out in the two Pracs led by Professor Richard Fuller, you will complete a written assessment. Full instructions will be given in class. Focus on quality and creativity in your answer. The prac work may be done in pairs or groups, but this assessment MUST be done individually. Plagiarism will not be tolerated.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assessment items for internal courses should be submitted in accordance with the submission requirements listed in Jac. ONLINE SUBMISSION BY TURNITIN ONLY by the due date. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets required.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
